pull_requests.title: Format spec output as a christmas tree
Update development dependencies
pull_requests.body: Mostly for rspec 3.4, fixed a load of spec warnings too

pull_requests.title: Don't test old versions of rails
Use Time.zone.today instead of Date.today
pull_requests.body: Based on the feedback from Codacy here: https://www.codacy.com/app/24PR/24pullrequests/dashboard

pull_requests.title: v1.0.0
pull_requests.body:
Updated dev dependencies and bumped version to v1.0.0

Fixes #29

pull_requests.title: Add list of muted github logins, don't tweet those users prs
pull_requests.body:
Added @bsipocz to the list to begin with 🙊 

Fixes https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/issues/1639

pull_requests.title: Fixed some rubocop warnings
pull_requests.body: Including some tweaks to the .rubocop.yml config :christmas_tree:

pull_requests.title: Added more versions of node to travis config
Readme tweaks
pull_requests.body: Removed the open collective bits and updated contributor count ❄️

pull_requests.title: Remove konacha javascript tests
pull_requests.body: Konacha added a lot of dependencies and overhead just to test the emoji js and it's not been updated to work with rails 5 either so I'm taking a 🔪  to it and removing it for now, will make things simpler for new users and less of a headache for upgrading to rails 5.

pull_requests.title: Add Delphi as a valid language
Update dependencies
pull_requests.body:
Noticed there were a few dependencies that were quite behind the latest so I updated those, plus rebuilt the shrinkwrap file too.

:christmas_tree:

pull_requests.title: Improve description of the project in readme
Gem updates
pull_requests.body:
Locks typhoeus to 1.1.0 until https://github.com/typhoeus/typhoeus/issues/551 is fixed

Fixes #1655
Fixes #1657
Fixes #1659 

💎

pull_requests.title: Browse open issues on your dependencies
Add new lines to dasher controller
Make sql do the work to find 24 random users with pull requests
pull_requests.body: We're currently loading 200 user records and 200 org records into memory on every homepage request, this just randomly picks from any users who have sent at least 1 pr in SQL 🚅

pull_requests.title: Added config for travis-ci
pull_requests.body:
Now you can run the tests on http://travis-ci.org :dancer: 

Config tests against some of the more popular versions of node.

:santa:

pull_requests.title: User issues
pull_requests.body:
Not linked anywhere yet as the issue data needs more syncing but here's the example urls:

- https://libraries.io/github/andrew/contribulator/dependency-issues
- https://libraries.io/github/andrew/dependency-issues

Also an extra one:

- https://libraries.io/github/andrew/issues

![screen shot 2016-12-02 at 6 18 56 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1060/20845195/d05a015e-b8bb-11e6-9309-82879709c494.png)
![screen shot 2016-12-02 at 6 18 19 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1060/20845196/d07023e4-b8bb-11e6-9ded-55285f3b5f27.png)
![screen shot 2016-12-02 at 6 18 09 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1060/20845197/d08725bc-b8bb-11e6-8f95-2715a6bef921.png)

pull_requests.title: Improved footer
pull_requests.body: Add links to brave new software, slack and updates support link, plus pretty icons ✨ Fixes #968 Fixes #850 Related to #964

pull_requests.title: Only show usage stats for non-forked repos
pull_requests.body:
Forks may be skewing the numbers slightly, only showing non-forked repo usage data until we have a reliable way of determining if a fork is being used or just github mess left behind after a pull request.

Related to #934

pull_requests.title: Show 6 prs on the homepage next to the 6 projects
pull_requests.body:
![screen shot 2016-12-08 at 9 42 18 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1060/21004905/a06a2d98-bd2a-11e6-96ab-1dc7857b50ca.png)

Currently we almost always have a slightly longer projects column on the homepage, this adds an extra pr to the left to balance them out 🎁

pull_requests.title: Improve contributing.md
pull_requests.body: Based on the excellent work of @alicetragedy on 24pullrequests: https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/pull/1677 💝

pull_requests.title: Allow passing a date to the tree resolver to enable time traveling
Show pull requests that a user has merged this year
pull_requests.body:
As part of working towards fixing https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/issues/1611, let's start showing which pull request a user has merged (if any) on their profiles:

![screen shot 2016-12-09 at 10 41 53 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1060/21046364/47e9ea28-bdfc-11e6-9296-e7093dc213fd.png)

n.b. The tab doesn't show if you've not merged any pull requests this December.

pull_requests.title: Allow time travelling in dependency tree api
pull_requests.body:
Adds the same data param as https://github.com/librariesio/libraries.io/pull/978 but to the API version of the tree resolver.

Example: https://libraries.io/api/npm/base62/tree?kind=Development&date=2014/7/15&api_key=XX

pull_requests.title: Convert User#uid field to integer to allow joining with id columns
pull_requests.body: Following on from https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/pull/1708, changing the uid field to integer allows for easy joining across the pull request table to find the most prolific mergers for https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/issues/1611

pull_requests.title: Added top mergers page
pull_requests.body:
Adds a page that lists people who've merged a pull request that was opened as part of 24pullrequests, ordered by most merged, related to https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/issues/1611

![screen shot 2016-12-09 at 12 18 09 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1060/21048891/9009c5be-be09-11e6-94a8-4a789c5b22e9.png)

Also works with 2015 data:

![screen shot 2016-12-09 at 12 17 29 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1060/21048899/9b2dcd14-be09-11e6-9633-b30adaeb31e0.png)

pull_requests.title: Remove multi_fetch_fragments
pull_requests.body:
We don't need this now as it's built into rails 5

Related to #1720

pull_requests.title: Rename org description field to bio
Updated the default widgets
pull_requests.body:
![screen shot 2014-12-10 at 10 22 18 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1060/5385527/0700e67c-80bb-11e4-8316-e63d9a163ac0.png)

Thanks to @blainesch for his first two widgets.

pull_requests.title: Daily and weekly reminder email content
Fixed link to Github API docs
pull_requests.body: As part of http://24pullrequests.com, giving back little gifts of code for Christmas.

pull_requests.title: Reverted to redis 0.7.2
pull_requests.body: 0.8.x causes a `hmset expected value to be a string` error.

pull_requests.title: Fixed invalid html on homepage
pull_requests.body: There were two body tags and the IE html conditions were incorrect, both have been fixed now.

pull_requests.title: Removed text-shadow from site name
pull_requests.body: White on white looked a bit ugly, I'll send over some more design improvements when I get the chance.

pull_requests.title: Fixed incorrect heading in shipment docs
Updated webmock version check to 1.9.1
pull_requests.body:
WebMock 1.9 is now a development dependency it would appear that it is supported (works great on my project with 1.9)

So this moves the warning up to the next potential release of webmock, removing the warning for 1.9.0 users.

pull_requests.title: Use factories instead of fixtures
pull_requests.body: We're only using fixtures in one place (`spec/gift_spec.rb`) and factories everywhere else, should probably use the same everywhere.

pull_requests.title: Removed extra line breaks from travis docs
pull_requests.body: These were showing up in the services UI making the description look broken.

pull_requests.title: Improved readme
pull_requests.body: Added syntax highlighting and markdown rendering on Github.com

pull_requests.title: Fixed mailer spec
pull_requests.body: mail.from was stripping the name and only returning the email address, so instead checking the full "From" header looks correct.

pull_requests.title: Fixed pull request downloads controller spec
Don't send emails after xmas eve
Removed the old information box
pull_requests.body: No need to show it now that it’s December

pull_requests.title: Cache gems and assets in travis
pull_requests.body:
Should speed up the test suite a fair amount.

As outlined here: http://about.travis-ci.org/blog/2013-12-05-speed-up-your-builds-cache-your-dependencies/

pull_requests.title: Added Organisations section to the homepage
Fix path to background image
pull_requests.body: Uses the rails asset-url so the asset pipeline can handle it.

pull_requests.title: Reduced the travis build matrix
pull_requests.body: Checking rails 3.2, 4.0 and 4.1 and only ruby 2.1.5 now as well.

pull_requests.title: Use the new travis container based infrastructure
pull_requests.body:
http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/workers/container-based-infrastructure/

Hat tip to @arthurnn giving me the idea from https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/pull/741

pull_requests.title: Revert "Limit PRs to those created this year"
Updated rails to 4.1.8
pull_requests.body:
Had to rename the `public` scopes to `communal` to avoid this exception: https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/15032

Rails 4.1.8 comes with lots of goodies and most importantly security fixes!

pull_requests.title: Upgraded ruby to 2.1.5
pull_requests.body:
Comes with some security fixes and nice performance boosts.

You'll need to bundle install locally to get all the gems installed for this version of ruby.

pull_requests.title: Don’t look issues on inactive projects
pull_requests.body:
The rake task for checking for inactive projects was allowing any project with an open issue, even if it's not had a commit in 6 months.

In a future update we should switch to using @kdaigle's score checker from https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/pull/705 and run this task on a more regular basis.

Fixes https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/issues/697

pull_requests.title: Allow failures for node v0.11 on travis
pull_requests.body: As v0.11 is supported at the moment, this makes it more helpful to know if v0.10 is passing tests.

pull_requests.title: Use new travis env for faster tests and bundler cache
pull_requests.body:
http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/workers/container-based-infrastructure/

Hat tip to @arthurnn giving me the idea from https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/pull/741

pull_requests.title: Test fix
pull_requests.body: Fixing up some broken tests from https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/pull/761

pull_requests.title: Lazy load admin users
pull_requests.body:
Having the admin users being pulled from GitHub when the rails app boots up has felt like a :nose: for a while, instead let's have a class method on User which lazily loads them the first time it's called and memoizes it.

This also avoids hitting any rate limit issues by ensuring we have a good token to talk to the api with on any request.

:snowboarder:

pull_requests.title: Ignore all the automatic coderwall orgs
pull_requests.body: They just make the org list look messy

pull_requests.title: Order orgs by pr count and then nickname
Order org members by their pull request count
Store name, blog and location from github user responses
pull_requests.body: More data in our db means less data to load via the github api later :+1:

pull_requests.title: Lazy load contributors
pull_requests.body:
Building on top of https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/pull/767 and following the style of https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/pull/764, I've simplified the humans.txt loading. 

Tests are totally broken right now though!

pull_requests.title: Normalized all translation files
pull_requests.body: Started playing around with [i18n-tasks](https://github.com/glebm/i18n-tasks), releated to #861 :snowboarder:

pull_requests.title: Updated mac binary for libsass 3.1 alpha
Update organisation pull_request_count after a user is added to it
pull_requests.body: So we're out of sync for slightly less of the time.

pull_requests.title: Always show the ‘suggest a project’ link on /my_suggestions
Remove big gap on language pages
Order users by pull_request_count and nickname
Gracefully handle GitHub API failures
pull_requests.body:
Fixes #776, which is caused by seed users having invalid GitHub API tokens, which throws an exception in a few places.

This rescues those exceptions and also removes the seed data block that generated users from data on GitHub.

pull_requests.title: Project counts should only count active projects
pull_requests.body: Now that I've made more projects in active, this makes the count match the actual amount of projects we'll suggest.

pull_requests.title: Project score tweak
pull_requests.body:
Initially the popularity scorer from https://github.com/24pullrequests/24pullrequests/pull/705 checked to see how many commits had been made on a project but the [commits api](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/commits/#list-commits-on-a-repository) makes this call really slow when the repo has had a lot of commits in the last 3 months, it doesn't look like that endpoint respects any of the pagination options so there's no way to limit the response.

For now I'm just going to check to see if the repo has been updated in the last 3 months, which likely means there was at least one commit to master.

cc @kdaigle

pull_requests.title: Only show events on dashboard if there are any upcoming
pull_requests.body: Removes the sidebar section and heading entirely for now :ski:

pull_requests.title: No need to include pull_requests when loading users here
pull_requests.body: We're not using any pull request data in these calls so let's remove them and speed up the query.

pull_requests.title: Correctly order user collections in language controller
pull_requests.body: So it matches the ordering style from `UsersController`

pull_requests.title: Ensure labels and languages are arrays
pull_requests.body: This fixes one of the most frequent errors I see in Bugsnag.

pull_requests.title: State bundler dependency
pull_requests.body:
Bringing https://github.com/rails/spring/pull/293 back from the :skull:, resolves #275 

cc @strzibny

pull_requests.title: Added spring for faster console and test startup
pull_requests.body:
Should bring some nice, automatic speedups in development.

See https://github.com/rails/spring for more details.

pull_requests.title: Added a more useful page title
pull_requests.body: So it's easier to find among other tabs.

pull_requests.title: Added onscreen-keyboard plugin to readme
pull_requests.body:
https://github.com/andrew/webflight-onscreen-keyboard is now usable, mostly by @escapologyBB, so it would be good to get more :eyes: on it.

:snowman:

pull_requests.title: Upgraded to ruby 2.2.0
pull_requests.body:
:warning: **Don't merge this yet** :warning: 

Just warming up for the likely Christmas day release of Ruby 2.2.0.

Heroku has 2.2.0-preview2 available and Travis has 2.2.0-preview1 atm, just wanted to see if the tests pass at the moment.

:gem:

pull_requests.title: Added rack-canonical-host for domain redirection
pull_requests.body: https://github.com/tylerhunt/rack-canonical-host is perfect for redirection *.herokuapp.com domains to the canonical one in #786.

pull_requests.title: Specify a ruby version
pull_requests.body: Ruby 2.1.5, same as the 24 Pull Requests rails app

pull_requests.title: Updated gosu to 0.8.6
pull_requests.body: I was having trouble installing gosu 0.7.45 on Mac, but the latest version works great so I upgraded the dependency.

pull_requests.title: Link through to contributors list in readme
pull_requests.body: To save the authors list getting out of date after every PR :christmas_tree:

pull_requests.title: Inactive project improvements
pull_requests.body: Lets use @kdaigle's score pr from #705 to improve the deactivating of projects.

pull_requests.title: Updated some gem dependencies
pull_requests.body: A little pull request to start the day off right :gift:

pull_requests.title: Improve Project url validation
pull_requests.body: Previously urls like `https://github.com/foo/` and `https://github.com//` incorrectly passed the validation, resulting in confusion like #682, this fixes it.

pull_requests.title: Email confirmation flash refactoring
pull_requests.body: Moved some of the logic into the user model and only show the message if a user has entered an email. :love_letter:

pull_requests.title: Fix deprecations warnings
pull_requests.body: Plus removed a couple of unused gems

pull_requests.title: Removed Guard auto-testing setup
pull_requests.body: Our guard setup hasn't worked in quite a while, I don't use it and I suspect not many others do either so I'm removing it for now.

pull_requests.title: Use number_with_delimiter anywhere that counts are over 1000
Moved event view duplication into a partial
Remove archived pull request related code
Move package managers links into Repository Classes, fixes #470
Notification controller refactoring
pull_requests.body: Doesn't fix any bugs, just cleans up some duplication and adds a few tests ✊

pull_requests.title: Stopgap fix for syncing old notifications
pull_requests.body: As it's annoying me, this pr will kludge it until https://github.com/andrew/octobox/issues/125 is properly fixed :feelsgood:

pull_requests.title: Move some filter logic into helper methods
pull_requests.body:
Just gets some of the filter logic away from the html

cc @knolleary

pull_requests.title: Allow filtering by owner
pull_requests.body:
For: https://github.com/octobox/octobox/issues/144 cc @knolleary 

Enables the `owner` url parameter to filter in the same way as the others, this works because we store the owner in a separate field since #74, denormalization ftw!

pull_requests.body:

pull_requests.title: Replace babel-present-es2015 with babel-present-env
pull_requests.body:
I noticed this warning when installing our dependencies with yarn:

![screen shot 2017-12-21 at 14 47 30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1060/34260463-f779953a-e65d-11e7-8b89-893291de1b47.png)

so I thought I'd see if I could fix it for you by following the guide here: http://babeljs.io/env

I also committed all the generated files for demo and demoRouter, let me know if you'd prefer not have those in there and I'll remove them from this PR.
